<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module2_mcq_q36')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">
An investor bought a stock for $100 and sold it 5 years later for $161.05.  
What was the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of this investment?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q36" value="A"> A. 8%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q36" value="B"> B. 9%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q36" value="C"> C. 10%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q36" value="D"> D. 10.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q36" value="E"> E. 12%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q36" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
âœ… Correct: D. CAGR = \(\left(\dfrac{161.05}{100}\right)^{1/5} - 1 = (1.6105)^{0.2} - 1 \approx 0.10 = 10.0%\).  
This reflects the constant annual growth rate that would transform $100 into $161.05 over 5 years.
